text: sorry for the delay everyone - I've finally made some headway on this. Spoke with Tigabu of Eshi Express today and he helped me understand what is being done on the ground today by the delivery services. He said that the most important thing that can be done is spread the word about the services - would be helpful if we could use social media (influencers/MoH) to spread the word. They are already cutting delivery costs to make it more accessible - I think we might be able to help subsidize it even further if necessary with some fundraising. He also gave me direct contact info for RIDE, ZayRide, Asbeza, and Kedame Gebeya founders so I'm going to be calling/texting them. I'm busy with work right now but I will formalize my thoughts and get back to those interested in pushing this project forward.

text:
Fresh Corner's sign today...
(Fresh Corner is a like a corner vegetable shop with several outposts around Addis, for example <http://Asbeza.net|Asbeza.net> delivers from Fresh Corner...with same day & next-day delivery options)

Fresh Corner's sign today...
(Fresh Corner is a like a corner vegetable shop with several outposts around Addis, for example
delivers from Fresh Corner...with same day & next-day delivery options)

text: that's great that they're taking this initiative! it seems like the biggest/most immediate impact we can have is making the availability of these services known to more people. It could be as simple as breaking them down by location and providing the name/number of each service available in a poster. Will include this in my idea brainstorm
